Package game.general

Class Dungeon

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.general.Dungeon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    K
    public class Dungeon
extends java.lang.Object
implements K
    This class handles the player navigation and the core gameplay (apart from the monster battles) as well as the UI related to the gameplay.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Room currentRoom
      Represents the room in which the player currently resides.
      private char entrancePos
      Stores the entrance position.
      private boolean gameWon
      Stores the game result (game won/lost).
      private Player player
      Stores a reference to the player.
      private java.util.Scanner scanner
      Stores a reference to a Scanner-instance.
      private VisualEffectManager visualEffectManager
      Stores a reference to a VirtualEffectManager-instance.

      • Fields inherited from interface game.data.K

        AMOUNT_OF_LINES, CONSOLE_MARKER, CONTAINER_LABELS, CURRENCY, DIRECTION_ORDER, DIRECTIONS, DRAGON_DESC, DRAGON_HP, DRAGON_MAX_DMG, DRAGON_NAME, E, ENVIRONMENT_CHECK_MSG, ESCAPE_OPTION_MSG, GRENADE_DMG, GRENADE_NAME, HEALTH_POTION_DESC, HEALTH_POTION_HP, HEALTH_POTION_NAME, INITIAL_PLAYER_HP, INITIAL_PLAYER_MAX_DMG, KITTEN_DESC, KITTEN_LOCKED_DESC, KITTEN_NAME, KITTEN_VALUE, LEFT_CAVE_MSG, LOSE_MSG, MONSTER_DESC, MONSTER_HP, MONSTER_MAX_DMG, MONSTER_NAME, N, NAME_PROMPT_MSG, PLAYER_DESC, ROOM_AMOUNT, ROOM_DESCRIPTIONS, S, SALTA_PINNAR_DESC, SALTA_PINNAR_LOCKED_DESC, SALTA_PINNAR_NAME, SALTA_PINNAR_VALUE, SWORD_DESC, SWORD_DMG, SWORD_NAME, W, WELCOME_MSG, WIN_MSG

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void findTreasure()
      Applies an effect specific for the treasure on the player.
      boolean getGameWon()  
      private void move​(Room room)
      Move to another room.
      void playGame()
      Navigation and core gameplay is handled in this method (apart from the battles)
      private void printAvailableDoors()
      Prints the directions in which the player can go in from the current room and information regarding the doors - if they are unlocked, locked, lead to an exit or both.
      void printConsumablesOnPlayer()
      Prints all the consumables which the player possesses.
      private void printItemsInRoom()
      Prints all the items (including the keys in the room's keyring) of the current room.
      private void processPickedUpItems()
      Handles the processing of the items in the current room, including Key-objects in the room's keyring if the player has chosen to pick them up.
      private boolean welcomePrompt()
      A prompt which welcomes the player during the start of the game.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • player

        private final Player player
        Stores a reference to the player. Represents an entity which the user navigates and plays the game with.

      • currentRoom

        private Room currentRoom
        Represents the room in which the player currently resides.

      • entrancePos

        private final char entrancePos
        Stores the entrance position. Determines the direction in which the user has to go when the game starts.

      • scanner

        private final java.util.Scanner scanner
        Stores a reference to a Scanner-instance. The purpose is to take and store data inputted by the user.

      • visualEffectManager

        private final VisualEffectManager visualEffectManager
        Stores a reference to a VirtualEffectManager-instance. Used for visual effects (clearing the console between pre-determined stages)

      • gameWon

        private boolean gameWon
        Stores the game result (game won/lost).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dungeon

        public Dungeon​(Player player,
               Room startingRoom,
               char entrancePos,
               java.util.Scanner scanner,
               VisualEffectManager visualEffectManager)
        Parameters:
        player - The player-entity for the game.
        startingRoom - The room in which the player starts the game.
        entrancePos - The position of the first entrance.
        scanner - A scanner, used to take user input in this case.
        visualEffectManager - Used to take care of clearing the console.

    • Method Detail

      • getGameWon

        public boolean getGameWon()
        Returns:
        true if gameWon is true. Returns false otherwise.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Navigation and core gameplay is handled in this method (apart from the battles)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If something goes wrong while clearing the console.

      • move

        private void move​(Room room)
        Move to another room.
        Parameters:
        room - The room which becomes the new current room when moved.

      • welcomePrompt

        private boolean welcomePrompt()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        A prompt which welcomes the player during the start of the game. Excepts the user to exit a cave in a pre-determined direction.
        Returns:
        true if the player enters the cave. false otherwise, if the player chooses to exit the game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If something goes wrong while clearing the console.

      • findTreasure

        private void findTreasure()
        Applies an effect specific for the treasure on the player. Prints the value of the treasure and removes the treasure from the room.

      • printItemsInRoom

        private void printItemsInRoom()
        Prints all the items (including the keys in the room's keyring) of the current room.

      • printConsumablesOnPlayer

        public void printConsumablesOnPlayer()
        Prints all the consumables which the player possesses.

      • printAvailableDoors

        private void printAvailableDoors()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Prints the directions in which the player can go in from the current room and information regarding the doors - if they are unlocked, locked, lead to an exit or both.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If a Door-object with an invalid direction exists.

      • processPickedUpItems

        private void processPickedUpItems()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the processing of the items in the current room, including Key-objects in the room's keyring if the player has chosen to pick them up.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If something goes wrong while clearing the console.
